image.altText: A silhouette of a man leans over a fishing pot on a boat, a glowy orange sunset reflects on the ocean behind him

props.synopsis: Four months after a toxic algal bloom was first detected off South Australia's coastlines, business owners on the Yorke Peninsula say they are in dire need of support if they are to survive the ongoing marine disaster.

title.children: Algal bloom impact 'like something you'd see in a horror movie', fisher says

image.altText: A man kneels in front of a wall with faces of people painted on.

props.synopsis: Uncle Doug Nicholls is one of 20 Limestone Coast elders who tell their stories in a soon-to-be published book, passing on culture and learnings to the next generation.

title.children: Book preserves 'strength' of Indigenous elders for next generation

image.altText: Wide shot showing a suburban garden in Adelaide featuring a colourful array of foliage.

props.synopsis: How do you transform a blank-slate backyard into a plant-filled retreat when you don't have a clear plan or many resources? This Adelaide garden was built around existing fruit trees, using foolproof plants that were easy to propagate.

title.children: This garden was built on a small budget. Here are the key elements

image.altText: An Australian rules player leaps high into a pack and grasps the ball in both hands as players grimace around him.

props.synopsis: Football has evolved in the years since Barrie Robran hung up his boots, but as his beloved Roosters prepare to honour him following his death last week at the age of 77, tributes are continuing to flow for the man who, according to one eminent commentator, would have been a "champion in any era".

title.children: 'Bradman of footy' honoured by beloved Roosters

image.altText: A smiling large man in black jacket, light pants next to smiling, older, trim man holds a hose, next to grey holden.

props.synopsis: Malcom Harris had only just learnt CPR when he used it to save a man's life in the 1980s. Four decades later, during a routine trip to the car wash, the 94-year-old retiree was the one who needed saving.

title.children: Fisherman uses 30 years of CPR training to save life at car wash

image.altText: Two people looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The siblings who discovered the body of Rosemary Brown 25 years ago have spoken for the first time, as police renew the search for her missing daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Children linked to 25-year cold case speak for the first time

image.altText: Two dolphins leaping out of the water

props.synopsis: Inside one of the world's only city-based dolphin sanctuary, the pod population has halved since becoming protected and experts fear some of their biggest challenges are ahead.

title.children: Going beneath the surface to protect dolphins

image.altText: A group of Adelaide Crows and Port Adelaide AFL players run through a single banner - it reads "Vale Phil Walsh 1960-2015".

props.synopsis: The tragic death of Crows coach Phil Walsh stunned the football world and united the two halves of Adelaide — two weeks later, Adelaide met Port Adelaide in a game like no other. On the 10th anniversary, Andrew McGarry looks back at Showdown 39.

title.children: 'Never experienced anything like it': A decade on from the Phil Walsh Showdown

image.altText: GettyImages-2225957486

props.synopsis: Steven May will face tribunal scrutiny after leaving Francis Evans bloodied in a contest, as Maurice Rioli lights up Perth with his defensive work.

title.children: 'Intent was to get the ball' Goodwin backs May after sickening clash leaves Blue bloodied

image.altText: Two women with arms on their hips in a large hall, some dancers hang around a stage

props.synopsis: Three of Ukraine's most celebrated dancers have travelled from war-torn Kyiv to Australia to conduct a week-long traditional dance masterclass.

title.children: Honoured Ukrainian dancers 'pass legacy on' as war continues

image.altText: A police security office in a navy uniform walks down a road to a large school building

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man alleged to have made repeated violent threats against Glenunga International High School has been released on bail by South Australia's Supreme Court.

title.children: Teen released on bail following alleged violent school threats

image.altText: A screenshot of two people in an intimate embrace looking shocked

props.synopsis: Tech CEO Andy Byron resigns after being caught in an embrace with his company's chief people officer at a Coldplay concert.

title.children: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigns after Coldplay concert saga

image.altText: An Indigenous ranger sitting on a boat, looking over the water through binoculars.

props.synopsis: Foreign fishers illegally entering Australian waters have been caught in their dozens in the Top End in the past 12 months, marking a concerning spike for rangers.

title.children: In Australia's north, rangers are battling a 'matter of national security'

image.altText: Three young men walk away from an aid distribution site, each carrying two heavy plastic bottles filled with water

props.synopsis: Gaza's health ministry says at least 36 people were killed by Israeli fire while on their way to an aid distribution site in Gaza.

title.children: Israeli fire kills dozens seeking aid in Gaza, hospital says

image.altText: Detective Superintendent Jason Box looks sideways

props.synopsis: In more than 30 years on the NSW Police force, Detective Superintendent Jason Box has never seen a Sydney gangland war like this one.

title.children: Sydney's gangland war unlike any ever seen by head of taskforce

image.altText: a hand holds a vape with neon coloured pink, purple and orange vapour

props.synopsis: Inside the world of vaping, where influencers, big tobacco and the black market stare down vape reforms and users hunting for a fix.

title.children: How influencers, big tobacco and the black market fight back against vape reforms

image.altText: Orange virus particles on a white and green dotted background

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says contact tracing is underway for the overseas-acquired case and the public "should not be concerned".

title.children: Second Australian case of new mpox strain detected in Queensland

image.altText: Tim Tszyu gets his gloves prepared by a trainer

props.synopsis: Australian super welterweight Tim Tszyu is looking to reclaim a world title in a rematch with the man who bloodied him last year, Sebastian Fundora. Follow live.

title.children: Tszyu dropped in the first in do-or-die rematch against Sebastian Fundora

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fundora vs Tszyu: Tale of the tape
Isaac Cruz gets the unanimous decision win
Brandon Figueroa gets the controversial decision

image.altText: An aerial proposal shot of a group of islands on the ocean

props.synopsis: By 2050, cities may float or fly, according to proposals cooked up by billionaires.

title.children: Futuristic cities shaped by billionaires and corporations

image.altText: Thymen Arensman holds his arms out in celebration of a stage win

props.synopsis: Dutch rider Thymen Arensman wins the Tour de France's toughest stage, but his Ineos-Grenadiers team is sanctioned after a spectator was hit by one of its cars.

title.children: Tour de France spectator hit by team car as Arensman claims toughest stage

image.altText: Pianist Keith Jarrett in 1975 playing a grand piano. The lid is partially open.

props.synopsis: Keith Jarrett's best-selling album, The Köln Concert, nearly didn't happen. We reflect on Jarrett's life in music and explore the mishaps that lead to this iconic recording.

title.children: It's the world's best-selling solo jazz album, but 50 years ago it nearly didn't happen

image.altText: A diver wearing scuba gear holds a triangular stone up to the camera, illuminated by soft light streaming through the water.

props.synopsis: For years, researchers have been trying to find ancient artefacts sitting on the ocean floor. Now they have brought in Indigenous rangers to help.

title.children: Survey of Australia's seabed turns up 'lost' archaeological treasures

image.altText: Billy Joel, wearing a leather jacket and dark sunglasses, scowls at the camera.

props.synopsis: This two-part, five-hour epic is essential viewing for anyone who's ever wanted to know more about one of pop's most guarded stars.

title.children: After 55 years, Billy Joel finally lets his guard down in 5-hour documentary

image.altText: An electric vehicle ultra rapid charging station with a car parked in front.

props.synopsis: The RAC in Western Australia pulls the plug on its "electric-highway" project, 10 years after it pioneered regional electric vehicle-charging networks.

title.children: End of the road for Australia's first electric vehicle-charging project

image.altText: A chart showing flu cases with a picture of a woman blowing her nose

props.synopsis: It feels like every year we're told this is one of the worst flu seasons on record. But this time around, doctors really mean it.

title.children: Feel like everyone is sick this year? Here’s why

image.altText: Emergency hospital sing with hospital building in background

props.synopsis: A falling palm tree strikes a seven-year-old girl playing in a backyard in the Darwin suburb of Tiwi.

title.children: Falling palm tree kills seven-year-old girl in Darwin

image.altText: A silver car with a broken tail light crashed into a pole at night.

props.synopsis: A car rams a crowd of people waiting to enter a nightclub along a busy boulevard in Los Angeles, injuring 30 people and leading bystanders to attack the driver, according to authorities.

title.children: Man whose car struck crowd outside Los Angeles club was shot, police say

image.altText: Jacinta Allan appears serious, standing inside.

props.synopsis: Premier Jacinta Allan's government has defied a deadline set by Victoria's parliament to publish documents detailing the state's childcare crisis.

title.children: Victorian childcare crisis data remains secret after missed deadline

image.altText: Couple looking at windmill

props.synopsis: Long drives for specialist and hospital treatment force older people to consider giving up their homes in regional Australia for better care in cities.

title.children: Stay or go? The tough choice Queenslanders make to live longer

image.altText: Jess Hull runs on the track during a race

props.synopsis: Olympic silver medallist Jess Hull sets an Oceanian and Australian national mile record while finishing runner-up at the London Diamond League meeting.

title.children: Jess Hull breaks Australian mile record at London Diamond League meet

image.altText: Harley Reid

props.synopsis: Joel Selwood. Trent Cotchin. Luke Hodge. That's the level West Coast assistant Luke Shuey believes Harley Reid will reach in the coming years, as the midfielder grapples with scrutiny over how he approaches the game.

title.children: High praise for Harley Reid amid AFL discipline concerns

image.altText: Crops growing on a farm on a sunny day in winter

props.synopsis: Rain brings some relief to drought-affected farmers in Victoria, but most of the state is still desperately dry.

title.children: Crops on a 'knife edge' in Victoria as drought continues to bite

image.altText: Two women embrace in a cemetery.

props.synopsis: Funeral photography is about capturing a family's story and emotions while farewelling a loved one.

title.children: Meet the photographers capturing the 'pure emotions' of funerals

image.altText: A woman in the distance walking over a hill with an old ruined car.

props.synopsis: Most Australian indie films disappear after they do the festival circuit, but a creative director says Aussie movies should be given "a leg up" with a quota system in cinemas.

title.children: Independent filmmaker's $100k spend and 'huge journey of self-belief'

image.altText: Two elderly women stand together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Wendy Pope and Esme Rash, both in their 90s, have remained firm friends for more than four decades.

title.children: 40-year friendship endures amid love, loss and service
